TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit BaseDataBoundControlDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for controls that are derived from the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup that describes a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> class is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control code is persisted to the markup source and edited into the markup for the Web page.
Designers that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner> abstract base class provide design-time support for controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of a designer that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner> class when it creates the associated control on the design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ConnectToDataSource() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, typically unhooks events from the previous data source, and then attaches new events to the new data source.
Docs.returns: if a connection to a new data source was performed, typically; if the old and new data sources are the same.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.ConnectToDataSource%2A> method typically involves unhooking events from the previous data source, and then attaching new events to the new data source.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void CreateDataSource() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, creates a new data source for the associated object.

remarks.format: ## Examples For an example of a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.CreateDataSource%2A> override that displays a dialog that can be used to create a data source for the associated control, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner.CreateDataSource%2A>.

block.para: Override the method to provide a means of creating a control for the associated object at design time.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void DataBind(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl dataBoundControl) cil managed

Docs.param: The with which this designer is associated.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, performs the necessary actions to set up the associated control that is derived from the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataBind%2A> method in a designer that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner> class, perform the necessary actions to set up the data-bound control so that when the design-time markup is retrieved, the control renders properly. Typically, you will associate a design-time data source rather than the live data source, for performance reasons.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the property for the associated control.
Docs.value: The data-binding expression used by the associated control derived from .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property is used to shadow the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> class that is associated with this designer. The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property is persisted by the designer as a data-binding expression on the tag that is generated for the underlying <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> object.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the property of the underlying object.
Docs.value: The ID of the associated with the underlying .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSourceID%2A> property is used to shadow the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> property of the underlying <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void DisconnectFromDataSource() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, unhooks events from the current data source.

block.para: Typically, when you override the method, you will disconnect the and events.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by the object, and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.Dispose%2A> method unhooks the event handlers for the designer from all data source events.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Generates the markup that is used to render the control at design time.
Docs.returns: The markup used to render the control at design time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner> class retrieves sample data that is used for binding purposes at design time before rendering the control. If the control is not data bound, it calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method. If there is an error rendering the control, it calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides the markup that is used to render the control at design time if the control is empty or if the data source cannot be retrieved.
Docs.returns: The markup used to render the control at design time with an empty data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner> class retrieves sample data that is used for binding purposes at design time before rendering the control. The empty design-time control renders as a placeholder that contains the type name and control name.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetErrorDesignTimeHtml(class System.Exception e) cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides the markup that is used to render the control at design time when an error has occurred.
Docs.returns: The markup used to render the control at design time when an error has occurred.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The error design-time control renders as a placeholder that contains the type name, the control name, and a message describing the error.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed

Docs.param: A control derived from , which implements .
Docs.summary: Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The designer host calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method when it is ready to use the designer to render a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> class. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method and its base methods configure properties and connect events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnDataSourceChanged(bool forceUpdateView) cil managed

Docs.param: to force the update of design-time markup; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Called when the data source of the associated object changes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> method connects to the current data source. If the current data source is different from the data source to which the control was previously connected, or `forceUpdateView` is `true`, the associated control is redrawn on the design surface.

block.para:
Override the method to perform additional actions that are required when the data source of the associated control changes.
If you override the method, call the base implementation before performing other processing.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnSchemaRefreshed() cil managed

Docs.summary: Called when the data source of the associated object loads a new schema.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.OnSchemaRefreshed%2A> method handles the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceDesigner.SchemaRefreshed> event, which is raised when the schema of the data source to which the associated control is bound changes. Override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.OnSchemaRefreshed%2A> method to perform additional actions that are required when new schema is available.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed

Docs.param: The containing the properties to filter.
Docs.summary: Used by the designer to remove or add additional properties for display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> class, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> shadows the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property of the control. It makes a copy of the attribute array of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A>, and then adds these attributes to the shadowed property. It sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute.Browsable%2A> attribute of the shadowed <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property to `false` unless the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute.Browsable%2A> attribute of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSourceID%2A> property of the control is already set to `true`.

block.para: Override the method to add properties to or change attributes of properties in the design-time property collection. Be sure to call the base method before performing other processing.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult ShowCreateDataSourceDialog (System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner controlDesigner, Type dataSourceType, bool configure, out string dataSourceID);

.method public static hidebysig valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DialogResult ShowCreateDataSourceDialog(class System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner controlDesigner, class System.Type dataSourceType, bool configure, string dataSourceID) cil managed

Docs.param: to enable editing of the configuration, or to disable configuration editing.
The ID of a control on the page.
Docs.summary: In a design host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)], displays a dialog box to assist the user in creating a data source.
